description: Manage admin rule collection with network.

commands.name: az network manager security-admin-config rule-collection create
commands.summary: Create a network manager security configuration admin rule collection.
commands.syntax:
az network manager security-admin-config rule-collection create --applies-to-groups
                                                                --configuration-name
                                                                --name
                                                                --resource-group
                                                                --rule-collection-name
                                                                [--description]
examples: az network manager security-admin-config rule-collection create --configuration-name "myTestSecurityConfig" --network-manager-name "testNetworkManager"  -g "rg1" --rule-collection-name "myTestCollection" --description "A sample description" --applies-to-groups  network-group-id="/subscriptions/sub_id/resourceGroups/rgid/providers/Microsoft.Network/networkManagers/TestNetworkManager/networkGroups/TestNetworkGroup"

commands.name: az network manager security-admin-config rule-collection delete
commands.syntax:
az network manager security-admin-config rule-collection delete [--configuration-name]
                                                                [--force {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                                                [--ids]
                                                                [--name]
                                                                [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                                                [--resource-group]
                                                                [--rule-collection-name]
                                                                [--subscription]
                                                                [--yes]
examples: az network manager security-admin-config rule-collection delete --configuration-name "myTestSecurityConfig" --network-manager-name "testNetworkManager" --resource-group "rg1" --rule-collection-name "myTestCollection"

commands.name: az network manager security-admin-config rule-collection list
commands.summary: List all the rule collections in a security admin configuration, in a paginated format.
commands.syntax:
az network manager security-admin-config rule-collection list --configuration-name
                                                              --name
                                                              --resource-group
                                                              [--max-items]
                                                              [--next-token]
                                                              [--skip-token]
                                                              [--top]
examples: az network manager security-admin-config rule-collection list --configuration-name "myTestSecurityConfig" --network-manager-name "testNetworkManager" --resource-group "rg1"

commands.name: az network manager security-admin-config rule-collection show
commands.summary: Get a network manager security admin configuration rule collection.
commands.syntax:
az network manager security-admin-config rule-collection show [--configuration-name]
                                                              [--ids]
                                                              [--name]
                                                              [--resource-group]
                                                              [--rule-collection-name]
                                                              [--subscription]
examples: az network manager security-admin-config rule-collection show --configuration-name "myTestSecurityConfig" --network-manager-name "testNetworkManager" --resource-group "rg1" --rule-collection-name "myTestCollection"

commands.name: az network manager security-admin-config rule-collection update
commands.summary: Update a network manager security configuration admin rule collection in a subscription.
commands.syntax:
az network manager security-admin-config rule-collection update --rule-collection-name
                                                                [--applies-to-groups]
                                                                [--configuration-name]
                                                                [--description]
                                                                [--ids]
                                                                [--name]
                                                                [--resource-group]
                                                                [--subscription]
examples: az network manager security-admin-config rule-collection update --configuration-name "myTestSecurityConfig" --network-manager-name "testNetworkManager" --resource-group "rg1" --rule-collection-name "myTestCollection"

commands.name: az network manager security-admin-config rule-collection wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
commands.syntax:
az network manager security-admin-config rule-collection wait [--configuration-name]
                                                              [--created]
                                                              [--custom]
                                                              [--deleted]
                                                              [--exists]
                                                              [--ids]
                                                              [--interval]
                                                              [--name]
                                                              [--resource-group]
                                                              [--rule-collection-name]
                                                              [--subscription]
                                                              [--timeout]
                                                              [--updated]
